author: machdiamond
title: Metadata Dictionary
description: The blockchain is a powerful accounting tool not being used to its full potential as an accounting tool.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposed team recognizes that Blockchain's powerful accounting tool is yet to be used to its full potential as an accounting tool. The proposal aims to build a metadata registry for B2B transactions as a basis for business and accounting activities. Propose a clear description and detailed solution. However, the team needs to consider and have positive solutions to the risks that may occur when implementing the project. From the master plan outlined, I am not confident enough for the success of the proposal
f6_assessments.q1: Proposal provides detailed information on the work to be done. However, it would be nice to add some milestones. What to do in different timeframes. Increase the clarity of the proposal. Additionally, the proposed budget is $185,000. More than 30% of the total challenge budget, but a fairly brief explanation of what needs to be allocated. The proposal will be sustainable if there is a division of the budget table for each implementation budget in the project. Another aspect would be beneficial to have more relevant profile information or a short presentation of the core team members. Include working time and budget allotted to them.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal provides a plan for each work to be done in the project, but without a clear timetable and KPI figures. It will be difficult to measure the progress and success of the project. The proposal will be transparent and easier to audit if there is a breakdown of the budget for each work implemented in the project.

f6_assessments.q0: This project has covers an aspect of development that is usually looked down upon as additional work needed to complete a project, but it is usually the most crucial.  Strong documentation and a dictionary of metadata could be extremely useful in helping understanding and building standards on how things are built.  This could highlight commonalities in the way that independent builders are developing their software and refine, share, and enforce best practices which would help the whole development side strive.
f6_assessments.q1: As monumental accomplishing this task would be, there are some question marks that are in how this solution would be developed, implemented and carried out.  The budget and size of the team sounds reasonable, but none of the team members are noted meaning mant members would be need to be contracted.
f6_assessments.q2: There are some basic metrics mentioned and lagging indicators of success.  More clarity on how these metrics and performance indicators can be objectively measured would be good.

f6_assessments.q0: This is a proposal that seems to create a metadata registry for the seamlessly adoption of an open source accounting standards for businesses on Cardano Blockchain infrastructure. The  proposal definitely provided a clear problem statement that meets the campaign objectives of this category. The aims is to ensure to have standardized business transactions that will serve a basis for organisation accounting task or related activities. This proposal will surely drive more user adoption of the network  by ensuring that businesses can integrate Cardano Blockchain into their business environment using this infrastructure as accounting tools for their business transactions.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal is not detailed, loosely articulated and barely make sense on how this proposal's plans to achieve it's goals. There is a sense of vagueness about the proposal. There is awfully lack of details that to give confidence that this proposal can be feasibly implemented. In addition, no details on the team's experience and competence. The budget breakdown and cost analysis is superficial and there is no basis to relate the estimates to the task to be done. Considered the the amount of fund requested, the proposal needs to be more detailed and articulated especially in the areas of cost analysis and Milestones to be achieved within a specified timeframe.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal provided some relevant  success metrics to monitor and verify the progress and development of the project. However, the detailed plans with strategic steps on how to implement the project, the metrics leaves little to be confident that this project can effectively monitored by community if the project is eventually funded.

f6_assessments.q0: this project May have some value but its hard to imagine..  It seems to be an accounting system. The budget is huge. I cannot see how it would increase the value to the system because it seems there are already many existing accounting systems, and why do we need another one? It would be better to create APIs into existing accounting systems.
f6_assessments.q1: Budget is very high. Is seeking to recreate an accounting system. May be better to link existing accounting systems into the blockchain rather than creating one from scratch.
f6_assessments.q2:
Auditability is given as 
Post survey data
Post at least 100 transactions using this metadata standard
Have at least 5 unique users contribute to the metadata repo
Reach consensus on at least the following metadata identifiers:
Organization

This is not sufficient audit criteria for a project asking for 150k USD.  Its a huge project. There needs to be must more measurable criteria.   The above is not enough.. only 100 transactions and 5 users?  This is easily achievable and does not give an accurate system as to the product's effectiveness.

f6_assessments.q0: The idea of putting accounting onto the blockchain is a really good one that just works with the immutable character of the Cardano blockchain and will sure show a good usecase. However it seems the SDG section has not been taken seriously and just any SDGs with or without relation to the proposal have been claimed to have to do with it.
f6_assessments.q1: The implementation plan is a bit short. The proposer does not disclose a lot about himself and his skills. The budget seems a bit random - far too high costs are associated with doing surveys and consultations. If you want to justify this amount of money, you need to properly explain what is done with it and how (in more than 3 bullet points - same goes for the second part of the budget that just has two bullet points). Also, the percentages presented don't add up and the wrong currency is used for the budget. It's nice that you think in ADA though ;-) Technical details are only explained coarsely. Feedback: I think your proposal has a lot of merit, but it seems as if it has been written in a bit of a haste. It would be a shame if that idea got lost by lack of planning. Please feel encouraged to post this proposal again in a future fund with the abovementioned points improved.
f6_assessments.q2: The auditability section on the other hand is good. the KPIs are decent and some (though few) success criteria are defined. The problem and solution statement are made well. The rosdmap is a bit short though and makes auditability throughout the process slightly more difficult. A bonus is the old proposal presented.

solution: Develop a metadata registry for standardized B2B transactions to serve as the basis for organization's accounting and business activities.
experience: Actively developing a fully integrated Business-on-the-Blockchain platform.
